image.altText: A sign reading "theatre" on the crumbling facade of a historic art deco cinema building.

props.synopsis: More than five decades since its heritage cinema closed, movies have returned to the big screen in the NSW town of Yass as part of an ambitious volunteer-led project to revive the town's historic art deco theatre.

title.children: Inside the race to restore Yass's unique 1939 art deco theatre

image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a navy suit stands behind a podium speaking seriously.

props.synopsis: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr acknowledges that leadership of the Labor party will "need to transition to a new generation" but argues stability is vital as Labor governs without the Greens.

title.children: 'Not thinking of retirement': Barr concedes succession looms but says experience key

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old Canberra boy is behind bars after shocking allegations he developed detailed plans for public attacks and had equipment to create a bomb in his bedroom.

title.children: Canberra 'wannabe terrorist' behind bars over plans to attack protesters

image.altText: Sena, an older woman wearing a headscarf and purple vest, stands looking serious, leaning against a wall.

props.synopsis: Sena Husic left a war-zone in Bosnia 30 years ago for Australia, and went on to suffer debilitating spinal pain because of the language barrier she struggled to overcome. Now she's finally received treatment, but there a calls for interpreters to bridge the gap.

title.children: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: A group of men in camouflaged military gear raise their fists triumphantly outside a large building.

props.synopsis: The latest chapter in Sudan's civil war has captured the world's attention. To understand what's happening now it helps to understand some of the country's history.

title.children: Mass graves and 'blood' seen from space: Inside Sudan's 'invisible' crisis

image.altText: Storm clouds gather over Mornington in Victoria

props.synopsis: Australia's weather has been highly volatile during the past fortnight, and this weekend will serve up another smorgasbord of atmospheric variability.

title.children: Smorgasbord of weather conditions to hit east coast this weekend

image.altText: A rail crossing on a regional road.

props.synopsis: A one-year-old girl has died after being clipped by a freight train in Baan Baa on the New South Wales north-western slopes.

title.children: Devastation in country town after freight train kills baby

image.altText: Graffiti on a bus stop in the Melbourne suburb of Melton.

props.synopsis: Five young people have died due to knife violence in two and a half years in the Melbourne suburb of Melton. Residents fear the situation is "out of hand".

title.children: In Melbourne's west, residents say street violence has 'come to their door'

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Andrew Wilkie has asked the PM to allow a free vote on banning gambling advertising and it appears many Labor MPs would support it.

title.children: Fear rules on gambling in Albanese government

image.altText: Smiling Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves, wears black jacket, white shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: The world's richest man's believers have once again agreed to enrich the Tesla boss to levels far beyond the realm of ordinary billionaires. But how much is enough?

title.children: Elon Musk's quest for trillions is merely a means to an end

image.altText: A close up of a cat looking through plants directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: On a speck of land in the Indian Ocean, one of the world's most ambitious wars is being waged against feral cats. But not everyone is celebrating.

title.children: Revered and reviled, cats in the crosshairs on Christmas Island

image.altText: A board flashes red to show which flights have been cancelled.

props.synopsis: With politicians in a bitter stand-off over spending priorities, Congress has ground to a standstill.

title.children: Hundreds of US flights cancelled as government shutdown drags on

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar has received nine nominations for the 2026 Grammys.

props.synopsis: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala and Rüfüs Du Sol will represent Australia at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards next year. Here is the full list of nominees.

title.children: Australian acts get nod as Kendrick Lamar, Lady Gaga lead Grammy nominations

image.altText: A man with a white beard, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death in custody of a Darwin prisoner has heard prison officers ignored concerns about the "comatose" man being placed alone in a cell.

title.children: NT coroner hears medical concerns brushed aside before death in custody

image.altText: The Kangaroos sing the national anthem ahead of the second Ashes Test in Liverpool.

props.synopsis: The Kangaroos may hold an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Ashes series, but they have not been completely satisfied with their performances in England.

title.children: Kangaroos focus on 'wonderful opportunity' in final Ashes Test

image.altText: A woman holding a baby

props.synopsis: One in five pregnant women are diagnosed with the condition, which experts say is linked to age, weight and a lack of exercise.

title.children: Mum shocked after being diagnosed with gestational diabetes as diagnoses rise

image.altText: A scuba diver underwater looking at a tray suspended in the water, on it are rectangular lead bricks.

props.synopsis: Some 2,000 years ago, a Roman ship sank off the coast of Sardinia. Now its cargo is being used to search for elusive phenomena like dark matter.

title.children: This ship sank 2,000 years ago. What's in it may help solve a cosmic mystery

image.altText: An old man

props.synopsis: James Watson, the controversial American biologist whose 1953 discovery of the structure of DNA ushered in the age of genetics, has died.

title.children: James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97

image.altText: A young protester in Madagascar wearing a flag with a skull and crossbones.

props.synopsis: Youth demonstrations in Madagascar are the latest in a number of gen Z protests across parts of Asia, Africa and South America, and young people are galvanised to join some of the largest protests of their generation.

title.children: An anime about freedom becomes a defining symbol of the rising gen Z protests

image.altText: A bearded man wearing a suit with a red tie looks on with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The United States and Britain remove sanctions on Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa, a day after the United Nations Security Council did the same.

title.children: US, UK lift sanctions on Syrian president Ahmed al-Sharaa

image.altText: A shop on a suburban shopping strip is fully engulfed in flames with smoke rising into the dark night sky.

props.synopsis: Residents were forced to evacuate their homes after a car was driven into a store and set alight in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Firefighters help residents flee Mentone tobacco shop fire

image.altText: Man inspecting tree branch

props.synopsis: Across the Blue Mountains, apple farmers are noticing less fruit this season. Some are wondering if it's linked to varroa mite.

title.children: These trees are usually laden with apples. This year they're strangely bare

image.altText: Police cars parked in a row

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man allegedly threw a spear at police officers before stabbing a probationary constable in the leg with a sword in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: 'Extremely confronting': Sydney police officer stabbed in leg with sword

image.altText: two boys holding up books

props.synopsis: When boys write their own comics, they are bound to be full of fart jokes, stinky-eyed butt dragons and lots of crazy superpowers.

title.children: New Wright Brothers take flight creating comics for kids

image.altText: The three members of Salt-N-Pepa wearing colourful bomber jackets and hats

props.synopsis: Salt-N-Pepa will this weekend be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in the musical influence category. The group, founded in 1985, has had a huge impact on popular music and culture.

title.children: Salt-N-Pepa's musical influence recognised by Rock & Roll Hall of Fame

image.altText: Women sit at spinning wheels in a factor, pic has a faded tone, yarns line the wall, women in skirts.

props.synopsis: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

title.children: How a regional textile mill connected Olympians, police and fashion

image.altText: An older woman in an elaborate hat smiles as she stands in a garden.

props.synopsis: The Princess Royal will make a quick trip to Australia to mark an important military anniversary.

title.children: Princess Anne is in Australia. Here's what we know of her plans

image.altText: Jamie Melham rides Half Yours at Flemington

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: A Melbourne Cup winner, a media storm and a toilet culprit

image.altText: A crowd of people standing outside next to a bus

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old student from an adjacent school is being investigated by Indonesian police after explosions injured 55 people on Friday.

title.children: Explosions at a mosque in an Indonesian high school injure 54

image.altText: Aine McDonagh kneels on the ground as she receives treatment during AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Injury-ravaged Hawthorn is counting the cost of its heavy loss to North Melbourne in the opening AFLW qualifying final.

title.children: Hawks faced with fresh injury concerns ahead of sudden-death AFLW semi

image.altText: Oscar Piastri looks on during practice at the São Paulo Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Lando Norris strikes the first significant blow of the São Paulo Grand Prix weekend by outpacing Oscar Piastri to take pole for the sprint race.

title.children: Piastri trails Norris in sprint qualifying at São Paulo Grand Prix

image.altText: WA Treasurer Rita Saffioti speaking while seated and her hands clasped.

props.synopsis: When it comes to Western Australia's slice of the GST pie, the state government is making no apologies for ruffling the feathers of other jurisdictions.

title.children: Saffioti says attack the best form of defence in protecting GST deal
